string.value: #b#p2020005##k said he will conduct an experiment with the ingredients, and told me to come back to him in a little bit.
I tried the experiment with b#p2020005##k but unfortunately it failed. #b#p2020005##k told me to go to see #b#p2030012##k, an expert on magic ingredients.
#b#p2030012##k said the inverse attributes is a bunch of nonsense. Nevertheless, he seemed intrigued by it and told me to go see #b#p2012017##k, the mad scientist in Orbis.
You gathered everything but unfortunately, the experiment didn't work out.
However, I found out why inverse element-based magic doesn't work. The magic itself is fine, but the there's something wrong with the #bmagic ingredients#k.
So I will change the ingredients and continue researching this. It's troublesome and hard. But, that's what study is. You will help me, right?
Good to hear. Do you know #b#p2030012##k? He's been been studying for a long time at the #bOrbis tower#k? He knows everything about ingredients. He can help, speak with him!
You look tired of gathering ingredients. Whenever you feel like studying, come on back. I'll be waiting.

Coughing...Hmm. What made you come here? Adventurers don't usually come this far. What can I do for you? \r\n#b#L0#I'm studying the inverse element-based magic with #p2020005#. And I need your help.#l
I know #b#p2020005##k. He has a really strange theory. Inverse elements? It can't be real.\r\n#b#L0#It's a magicians job to make the unreal possible.#l
If it was possible, many magicians would've learned it bynow. It's an interesting principle nonetheless...Would you like to know more?
It might be possible. Why don't you ask a scientist?
Do you know scientist #b#p2012017##k? He is concerned with magic as well as science. Ask him for help.
Don't you know where #b#p2030012##k is? He's in the corner of Orbis tower.
